result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Todd Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric Todd Hall is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eric Todd Hall was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment and any other conditions agent may deem appropriate.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric Todd Hall in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Defendant Eric Todd Hall in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Albrecht states delay of sentencing due to may have consolidated cases but not going to now.  No contest plea entered on Ct. 1.  Atty. Dolch makes statement of pending cases.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1
8 years prison (3 yrs IC /  5 yrs ES concurrent to any other sentence)
Credit from 4/24/2015 for a total of 598 days 
$528.00 costs/surcharges during supervision
DNA sample
Restitution per stip filed add the 10% during supervision - SAUK CO. SHERIFF DEPT to turn over the monies to COC to pay restitution
Any counseling/treatment and any other conditions per agent
Maintain full time employment
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Not Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

Ct 2:  DISMISSED
Ct.3:  DISMISSED

Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing on December 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Eric Todd Hall in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Eric Todd Hall in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states matter is resolved.  Plea today w/requested sentencing date to be set out in Br 1 as he's the assigned judge.  DE also wants time to potentially see about consolidation w/some cases in other counties.  Atty Raabe is in agreement.  Agrees w/jail credit at this point but parties will discuss any discrepancies prior to the sentencing date in Br 1.  State notes restitution stip has been filed w/the Court.  State says parties are in agreement that cash seized upon arrest would be applied to restitution.  Atty Raabe agrees and NC plea entered to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds DE guilty on Ct 1.  Court makes ruling on counts 2 and 3.  Parties agree to have JT removed from calendar.  Court advises parties to go talk to JA in Br 1 to get a sentencing date.  Parties are waiving any request for a PSI.  Bond continued pending sentencing.

Ct 1:  NC - ***Recommendation ***
8 years prison (3 yrs IC and 5 yrs ES concurrent to any other sentence)
Credit from 4/24/2015 for a total of 
$518 costs/surcharges
DNA sample
Restitution per stip filed today
Any other conditions per agent
Ct 2:  TO BE DISMISSED at sentencing
Ct 3:  TO BE DISMISSED at sentencing
Final pre-trial on October 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Final pre-trial on October 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial on October 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Todd Hall in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Eric Todd Hall in custody.  Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/Court Officer Clay Lins.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Raabe notes they will withdraw their motion at this time and request the matter be set for JT.  State is in agreement and notes there is $8,660.00 being held by SCSD at this time and the restitution is nearly that amount and that money will be held pending further resolution.  Atty Raabe states he thinks they are close to resolution but have some issues re: the money part of the settlement.  Parties agree they would need three days for trial.  Court sets matter for JT.  Court questions parties re: motions.  State would need time to reevaluate and requests MH be set in October.  Jury trial scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing on September 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Eric Todd Hall in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Eric Todd Hall in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe states matter is nearly resolved.  Requests short reset.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 02-05-2016 09:45 am.
Return date at 02-18-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Eric Todd Hall in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Eric Todd Hall in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe just appointed.  Requests PTC and another RD be set.  State agrees.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Eric Todd Hall in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Eric Todd Hall in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Frank gives status.  Defendant wishes Attorney Frank to withdraw.  Looking to have another attorney appointed through the Public Defender.  Cases pending in four other counties.  Defendant agrees.  Court grants request of Attorney Frank to withdraw.  Attorney Frank to advise the PD office so that they may appoint new counsel.  Bond continues.  Full discovery extended to defendant.  Motion to return vehicle was successful and vehicle was returned.  Unreturned cash still at issue.  Return date scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 1.
Defendant Eric Todd Hall in court with attorney Mark W. Frank.  Defendant Eric Todd Hall in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1

Defendant Eric Todd Hall by video from LEC with attorney Greg Sacra.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests cash bond of $20,000.  Atty Sacra responds.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $25,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to go to Arthur's Supper Club in Spring Green and not to leave the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 09:15 am.  Return date scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
